actions.text: Amendment SA 204 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 52 - 48. Record Vote Number: 58.

Amendment SA 204 proposed by Senator Bingaman for Senator Smith. (consideration: CR S2808-2817; text: CR S2811) To create a reserve fund for the establishment of a Bipartisan Medicaid Commission to consider and recommend appropriate reforms to the Medicaid program, and to strike Medicaid cuts to protect states and vulnerable populations.
Senate amendment agreed to: Amendment SA 204 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 52 - 48. Record Vote Number: 58.
Roll call votes on amendments in Senate: Amendment SA 204 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 52 - 48. Record Vote Number: 58.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 204 proposed by Senator Bingaman for Senator Smith.

purpose: To create a reserve fund for the establishment of a Bipartisan Medicaid Commission to consider and recommend appropriate reforms to the Medicaid program, and to strike Medicaid cuts to protect states and vulnerable populations.
